ygData.subject: Re: Resisting spells and fizzles?
ygData.msgSnippet: I m guessing from the story is that the human wizard is not as practiced at channeling or the specific spell type he was trying to cast.  I say this because
ygData.messageBody:
I'm guessing from the story is that the human wizard is not as practiced
at channeling or the specific spell type he was trying to cast. I say
this because when I first learned Invis. it was very hard to cast at
first, but as I gained skill in the type of spell it is (forget), I could
cast it without or little fizzling.


Kapolokok

Oh, and am I in the right list? Magician? I swear the list dealt with
pure spell casting groups.

On Wed, 26 May 1999, Wizard wrote:

> From: Wizard <wizard@...>
>
> I play a high elf wizard and i was gruped with a human wizard, we were both
> 13 lv and i see that he fizzles much much more and many times his spells
> are resisted? we are same lv and class only race is diferent we both have
> our skills maxed from chanaling to evocation and so on.
>
> maybe our stats affect the spells resistance i thing that wisdom can be
> very important factor in this? or it is dexterity?
>
> Anyone other have a similar experience?
>
>
>
> Silverion
> High elf wizard (against all statistics eheheeh)
